title: Ticket #6681: bake-in relevant functions of singularity wrappers to Condor
description:
From a few sources, I've heard that the OSG uses a job wrapper to handle a lot of the corner cases of Singularity jobs. Finally saw it today and I'm told this one is in use at Madison.

For starters, that is one heck of a script and its actual functionality is not self-evident. Here's what I see it doing:

  1. Follow symlink of an image and replace with its target. I think Singularity (2.5.1) might be doing this now, because running singularity shell gives me a prompt with the name of the target in it rather than the link.
  2. Hard-coded binding a few mountpoints in (e.g. /hadoop). This can be realized with SINGULARITY_BIND_EXPR.
  3. Bring in some extra bind points based on Job ClassAd (e.g. GPU, CVMFS). Are these generic enough to bake in?
  4. Set --contain (if not GPU jobs) and --ipc and --pid. It looks to me like Condor now uses -C (which is equivalent) by default but do not know if that is uniformly used for all jobs.
  5. Fix working directory in OSG-appropriate manner. I have filed #6676 to discuss precisely this point. Although the ticket has "shared filesystems" in its name, I believe the issue to be more generic.
  6. Fix X509 environment variables. This may have been resolved by #6625 and the recent release?

So, for starters, this probably isn't a full enumeration of the functionality. But, since it's in use at Madison, there must be a reason for it and some local expertise with it. In the grand spirit of HTCondor, there should be a knob / standard-ish job transform snippets for the bits that are generic.

I'm particularly concerned about #6676 and IWD handling.

I'm pushing Singularity very hard with some interested users and I'll admit to some frustration that a lot of effort must of gone into this wrapper but not so much into helping the HTCondor team identify the problems it's solving. To give an example, I believe the X509 problem was resolved in a week or two in response to a report by Matthias Schnepf from Germany. When... quite literally you have someone fixing it in a job wrapper down the hall from you.

Can we view this as a starting point for understanding where Singularity support stands and what might be snuck in before 8.8?
remarks:
2018-May-14 19:43:15 by gthain:
Tom:

We would like to remove the need to have this wrapper script as well.

  1. Looks like the singularity running in OSG fixes the need to explicitly follow symlinks, so, as you say, we don't need the part of the script

2 & 3: Note that the SINGULARITY_BIND_EXPR is evaluated in the context of the job and machine ad, so we can write expressions that the job can opt into certain mounts.

  1. Condor now uses -C (contain all namespaces)

  2. We'll work on this one

  3. As of #6625 and recent work on environment variables, this should all work.

So, it looks like we're just down to one issue this script is really taking care of.

2019-Apr-10 15:12:48 by pfc:
Can Greg please update this ticket with what if anything is still left to do, and can Tom update with how important it is to LIGO given the impact?

2019-Apr-17 14:10:14 by gthain:
I boldly proclaim there is nothing left to do. Independently, we've been working with the glidein folks to obviate the need to have a singularity wrapper, adding the SINGULARITY_EXTRA_ARGUMENTS (#6731), allowing condor_ssh_to_job to singularity jobs, and allowing X509 proxies to work with singularity #6625

2019-Apr-24 14:13:06 by pfc:
We're accepting Greg's bold unsubstantiated claim that this is resolved unless/until Tom or other have info or opinions to the contrary.
